intro: Lecanophora subacaulis, commonly known as the slender lecanophora, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
